Macro Definition Documentation

#define IOCTL_VPS_GET_DEI_CTX_BUF   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0006U)

Get DEI context buffers from driver.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] Vps_DeiCtxBuf *
cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
#define IOCTL_VPS_GET_DEI_CTX_INFO   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0004U)

Parameters

cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
#define IOCTL_VPS_GET_RANGE_MAP_REDUCT_CFG   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0010U)

Get Range Mapping and Range Reduction configuration.

When using this IOCTL the application should ensure that there is no input request pending with the driver. Otherwise the driver will return error.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] Vps_RngMapRdtCfg *
cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
#define IOCTL_VPS_RD_DEI_FMD_STAT   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x000DU)

Returns the FMD status, to be used only for debugging purpose.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] Vps_DeiFmdStatusReg *
cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
#define IOCTL_VPS_REGISTER_TIMESTAMP_FXN   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0011U)

Register an application function (pointer) for getting the time stamp value used at the frame completion time.

The same IOCTL could be used to un-register the existing time stamp function by passing NULL to the function pointer.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] const Vps_TimeStampParams *
cmdArgsStatusNULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure.

cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL

cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL

#define IOCTL_VPS_SET_DEI_FMD_CFG   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x000CU)

Enable/disable FMD operation of DEIH/DEI.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] const Vps_DeiFmdConfig *
cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
#define IOCTL_VPS_SET_RANGE_MAP_REDUCT_CFG   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x000FU)

Used to enable or disable VC-1 Range Mapping and Range Reduction Feature.

This IOCTL could be used by the application to enable or disable Range Mapping and Range Reduction for M2M drivers for the following paths a) Primary Input Path b) Auxiliary Input Path c) Both Secondary Input Paths.

This IOCTL will be used to enable or disable this feature for future frames of all channels

Range Mapping is supported for the range of values: 0 to 7 for Y and UV Component.

When using this IOCTL the application should ensure that there is no input request pending with the driver. Otherwise the driver will return error.

By Default Range Mapping and Range Reduction feature is disabled in the M2M drivers

Range Mapping is performed based on the following equations: Y[n] = (rngMapEnable) ? CLIP ((((Y[n] - 128) * (rngMapValY + 9) + 4) >> 3)

  • 128) : Y[n] ; Cb[n] = (rngMapEnable) ? CLIP ((((Cb[n] - 128) * (rngMapValUV + 9) + 4) >> 3) + 128) : Cb[n] ; Cr[n] = (rngMapEnable) ? CLIP ((((Cr[n] - 128) * (rngMapValUV + 9) + 4) >> 3) + 128) : Cr[n] ;

Range Reduction is performed based on the following equations: Y[n] = (rngRdtEnable) ? CLIP ((Y[n] - 128) * 2 + 128) : Y[n]; Cb[n] = (rngRdtEnable) ? CLIP ((Cb[n] - 128) * 2 + 128) : Cb[n] Cr[n] = (rngRdtEnable) ? CLIP ((Cr[n] - 128) * 2 + 128) : Cr[n];

The implementation performs Range Mapping first, and the output of Range Mapping drives Range Reduction.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] const Vps_RngMapRdtCfg *
cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
#define IOCTL_VPS_WR_DEI_FMD_UPDATE   (VPS_COMMON_IOCTL_BASE + 0x000EU)

Updates the FMD settings, to be used only for debugging purpose.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] const Vps_DeiFmdUpdateConfig *
cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
